comments:
This course provides an introduction to programming in C++ and is intended for
students who already have some exposure to programming in another language such as
Java, C++ provides the programmer with a greater level of control over machine
resources and are commonly used in situations where low level access or performance are
important. This course illuminates the issues associated with programming at this level
and covers issues such as explicit memory management, pointers, the compilation
process and debugging. The course involves several programming projects which provide
students with the experience they need to program effectively in these languages. This
course assumes programming experience equivalent to CIS 110, CIS 120 or ESE 112.
Students found this course to be an excellent introduction to C and C++ and
reported “learning more than [they had] expected.” Many students wished that there was
more lecture time, due to the amount of material covered.
Students felt that the instructor planned out an excellent syllabus. Some
commented that the lecture and homework material did not match up, which made the
assignments difficult for people with little C/C++ background.
Students mostly felt that there was too much work for a half credit class. They
also commented that homework should be graded more quickly.
This course review was written based on the 8 student comments received.
